p: β-lactoglobulin (β-Lg) is a globular protein with a molecular weight of 18 kDa and is very stable in acidic conditions [ 29]. It is generally in a dimer form at the isoelectric pH of 5.2 and alkaline pH range. The three-dimensional structure of this protein is greatly affected by temperature. At temperatures above 60 °C it starts to be denaturated also resulting in the appearance of some monomers which are responsible for milk intolerance in humans [ 29].
